node.title: Costa Rica issues COVID-19 vaccine requirement for children over five
node.alt: A masked healthcare worker administers a COVID-19 vaccine dose
node.description: Costa Rica becomes one of the first countries in the world to adopt a requirement for younger children to be vaccinated against COVID-19.Â
node.content:
["Costa Rican children aged five and older must get COVID-19 vaccinations, according to a new health ministry mandate, making the Central American country one of the first to adopt such a requirement for kids.\u00a0", "The move would add COVID-19 to a list of other infectious diseases in which vaccines for children have for years been required, including for polio and smallpox.", "\"Our basic vaccination scheme has made it possible to subdue many of the viruses that cause suffering and health consequences and even fatalities in the underage population,\" Health Minister Daniel Salas said in a statement\u00a0announcing the addition of COVID-19 to the scheme.", "Coronavirus infection rates in Costa Rica have been trending down recently, with confirmed COVID-19 deaths totaling more than 7,000, according to official data, out of a population of about 5.1 million.", "So far, nearly three-quarters of the country's 12 to 19-year-olds have received at least one vaccine dose, while about 54 per cent\u00a0of all Costa Ricans have been fully vaccinated.", "The US Food and Drug Administration this week issued approval for emergency use of Pfizer for children aged 5 to 11\u00a0\u2014 the first to be approved there for younger children.", "Pfizer has said a clinical trial showed its vaccine provides better than 90 per cent protection against symptomatic COVID-19 among children.", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
", "Reuters/ABC"]
